Detailed Description

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
class stemming::dutch_stem< string_typeT >

Dutch includes the following accented forms      -ä ë ï ö ü á é í ó ú è

Member Function Documentation

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::dutch_stem< string_typeT >::operator() ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline]

Parameters:
text string to stem

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::dutch_stem< string_typeT >::step_1 ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline, private]

Step 1: Search for the longest among the following suffixes, and perform the action indicated:

  1. heden
    • replace with heid if in R1

  1. en ene
    • delete if in R1 and preceded by a valid en-ending, and then undouble the ending

  1. s se
    • delete if in R1 and preceded by a valid s-ending

Define a valid en-ending as a non-vowel, and not gem.

Define a valid s-ending as a non-vowel other than j

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::dutch_stem< string_typeT >::step_2 ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline, private]

Step 2: Delete suffix e if in R1 and preceded by a non-vowel, and then undouble the ending

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::dutch_stem< string_typeT >::step_3a ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline, private]

Step 3a: heid delete heid if in R2 and not preceded by c, and treat a preceding en as in step 1(b).

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::dutch_stem< string_typeT >::step_3b ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline, private]

Step 3b: d-suffixes (*) Search for the longest among the following suffixes, and perform the action indicated.

  • end ing
    • delete if in R2.
    • if preceded by ig, delete if in R2 and not preceded by e, otherwise undouble the ending.

  • ig
    • delete if in R2 and not preceded by e.

  • lijk
    • delete if in R2, and then repeat step 2.

  • baar
    • delete if in R2.

  • bar
    • delete if in R2 and if step 2 actually removed an e.

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::dutch_stem< string_typeT >::step_4 ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline, private]

Step 4: undouble vowel If the words ends CVD, where C is a non-vowel, D is a non-vowel other than I, and V is double a, e, o or u, remove one of the vowels from V (for example, maan -> man, brood -> brod).
